summary: This may rub some of you die hard game of thrones fans the wrong way. But if Sansa ends up with anyone, especially a man, that...
body: This may rub some of you die hard game of thrones fans the wrong way. But if Sansa ends up with anyone, especially a man, that would be horrible writing. Not to mention, the men a lot of you seem to be shipping her with hold such titles as “my bastard brother” or “the man who pushed my brother out a window” or this throw back one “the hound who was a literally just a little nicer to her than he was to anyone else because she was a literal child in a horrible situation”

summary: Joffrey and the Queen Regent must renounce all claim to dominion of the north. From this time to the end of time, we are a free...
body:
Joffrey and the Queen Regent must renounce all claim to dominion of the north. From this time to the end of time, we are a free and independent kingdom.

Neither Joffrey nor any of his men shall ever set foot in our lands again. If he disregards this command, he shall suffer the same fate as my father…only I won’t need a servant to do my beheading for me!

Robb Stark fighting for Northern Independence

blog.description: your one-stop shop for melodramatic heartbreak poetry

summary: Sansa Stark
body:
Sansa Stark

So basically because everybody in GoT has tried to use Sansa as a pawn in their game, she now has a claim to and the loyalty of most of Westeros

Eldest born of Ned Stark, making her: Lady Stark of Winterfell.

Wed to Tyrion, Lord of Casterly Rock, making her: The Lady of Casterly Rock.

Wed to Ramsey Bolton, all Bolton’s are dead now, making her: The Lady of the Dreadfort (second largest holding in the North).

Eldest born of Catelyn Tully, giving her ties to the Riverlands. (All Edmure needs to do is die)

Because of Littlefinger’s scheming, she has the support from the Nights of the Vale.

Brienne of Tarth, the only heir to Tarth, is Sansa’s sworn sword.

….

She has grown so much, learned from the best manipulators in the game, suffered the worst traumas, survived it all, and now is one of the smartest/strongest characters still alive.

But please, go on about how she’s a useless character.

summary: Ghost headcanon.  Ghost is scared as hell of the dragons. He literally saw them coming down the Dany parade and hightailed it...
body:
Ghost headcanon. 

Ghost is scared as hell of the dragons. He literally saw them coming down the Dany parade and hightailed it inside the castle cuss fuck that. He spends most of his time now hiding under the Stark kid beds. Which is why we never see him in 8X01. Bran’s bedroom is his favorite because he’s never in there and he can sleep on top of his bed. 

Arya and Bran don’t mind but Sansa does because he gets fur all over her clothes, so she drags him to a balcony near the lord’s chambers every morning so she can brush his fur out. Maybe she gathers up all the loose fur and places it downwind from Dany’s open window, maybe she doesn’t. 

One day, Ghost takes a giant shit inside the great hall and because he’s a good pupper and feels bad he stands next to it so people know it was him.  Not like there’s anyone else to blame. Maybe the Hound? Seems like something he’d do for the lolz. 

Or a really dramatic, ‘what if Dany kills Ghost thinking he belongs to Sansa as retribution to being disrespected and it parallels Cersei killing Lady back in S1.’

Most of the castle staff are still scared of him so of course, Arya is stuck cleaning it up. No other Stark is going to help and Jon is off somewhere riding Daenerys a dragon or whatever. 

Arya is pissed, shoveling his shit into a sack with the newcomer Gendry’s help, “He never shat in the castle before, he’d always go out to the wood”. 

It was true. He preferred to shit out by the fresh smell of the pine, no one liked the smell of crap. Not even him. 

Gendry suggested she force him outside so he can see there’s nothing scary about the dragons. Yeah sure, Ghost thought to himself. You go shit out in an open field with two dragons flying up above. Gawking. 

He wasn’t afraid, it was undignified is all. Okay, so maybe he was a bit afraid. 

That’s how he ended up in his current situation, with Sansa and Arya the next day, trying their hardest to push him out of a back door to the wood behind Winterfell. 

Blessed Sansa was sitting on her ass in the snow, using her legs to push him forward. Arya was in front of him, dangling a dried up bone as if he were some idiot dog. She meant well. But could she have not put her skills to use and got him a fat cat instead?  

Bran looked on quietly from the side sitting in his chair by the door. Ghost was not one to judge his weird behavior, it did free up a nice day bed for him. 

Sansa to Bran, “Bran do you think you could -” 

“No” 

“But if you could just tie that rope to your -” 

“I need to hold the door.” 

Arya tossed the bone on the floor, “Don’t bother, he wouldn’t even hold a bag open for me to shovel shit into.” 

The bone was so dry it instantly broke into crumbs as it hit the ground. The disrespect from these Stark girls. 

“What’s the Lady of Winterfell doing ass first in the snow?” 

He turned his head to look behind him, the one they called the Hound approached.

Arya scurried to help Sansa up, “We’re trying to get Ghost outside, he keeps shitting in the castle.” 

This would have been his chance to hurry off, but the Hound picked him up by the scruff with ease. Surprising, and he finds that he doesn’t totally mind. 

‘It’s been a while since someone could do this’, he thinks, even if his back legs practically drag on the ground. ‘I could be into this’

But then, the traitorous Hound marches up to the door and throws him outside of the walls, slamming the entrance shut behind him. 

From inside he can hear Bran complain, “I was going to close the door.”

He shook himself of the shock, where was the respect for the sigil of this fine castle? 

‘I might as well take a shit, maybe find myself a fat rabbit if any are left.’

Somewhere up above Daenerys flys on Drogon. She was annoyed and attempting to cool down from her morning serving of Sansa Snark. She had told Jon twice now that she needed his sister to respect him and yet things remained the same. 

Dany had even tried to be kind. But today was her last day of attempts. 

She had offered to help Sansa brush out her dog this morning. It would have been of mutual benefit. The stupid thing shed like crazy, his white furs even managed to reach her rooms despite it never wandering into the guest wing of the castle. 

Sansa, of course, refused, “You should give your attention to your own pets, Your Grace.”

It was infuriating. Her children were not pets. She had given Sansa many chances, disrespect her so be it. Disrespect her children there would be consequences. 

So lost in her thoughts she was that the sudden speed of Drogon on the chase took her by surprise. She looked down. 

A wolf? Not just any wolf. Sansa’s. That’s what had gotten his attention. Could a pet plan revenge for his owner? No. But a child could. 

“Fuck those dragons!” could a direwolf not take a shit in peace anymore. He was already running back towards the castle at a speed he didn’t know he had 

Scarcely had he begun to dig up an area to relieve himself in when he caught the scent of the scaley beast. The service door was up ahead, surely the dragon would not attempt something inside the castle walls. 

Truth be told he couldn’t believe it was attempting something outside them. Has the stupid beast not seen the banners hung around the castle? I’m kind of a big deal here. 

He reached the door and pushed at it with his paws, letting his full weight fall on it. Any other day it would have given in, but not today. 

Bran, that little weirdo. He must have jammed it shut.

He turned to face the Dragon coming at him, mouth wide open, its teeth wet for his flesh. This was the end for him he knew. 

Nymeria was out there, she would come now that he’d be gone. He tried to feel for her, somewhere, to send a final message, “Stop being a forest thot and come home sister, they’ll need you now.” 

By the old gods, he would not give the beast the satisfaction of a delicious bite. 

He stood his ground and snarled, “Feast upon me monster! Savor my taste!”

And just as the dragon swallowed him into his mouth, he finally took his shit.

It was true. He preferred to shit out by the fresh smell of the pine, no one liked the smell of crap. Not even him. 

Gendry suggested she force him outside so he can see there’s nothing scary about the dragons. Yeah sure, Ghost thought to himself. You go shit out in an open field with two dragons flying up above. Gawking. 

He wasn’t afraid, it was undignified is all. Okay, so maybe he was a bit afraid. 

That’s how he ended up in his current situation, with Sansa and Arya the next day, trying their hardest to push him out of a back door to the wood behind Winterfell. 

Blessed Sansa was sitting on her ass in the snow, using her legs to push him forward. Arya was in front of him, dangling a dried up bone as if he were some idiot dog. She meant well. But could she have not put her skills to use and got him a fat cat instead?  

Bran looked on quietly from the side sitting in his chair by the door. Ghost was not one to judge his weird behavior, it did free up a nice day bed for him. 

Sansa to Bran, “Bran do you think you could -” 

“No” 

“But if you could just tie that rope to your -” 

“I need to hold the door.” 

Arya tossed the bone on the floor, “Don’t bother, he wouldn’t even hold a bag open for me to shovel shit into.” 

The bone was so dry it instantly broke into crumbs as it hit the ground. The disrespect from these Stark girls. 

“What’s the Lady of Winterfell doing ass first in the snow?” 

He turned his head to look behind him, the one they called the Hound approached.

Arya scurried to help Sansa up, “We’re trying to get Ghost outside, he keeps shitting in the castle.” 

This would have been his chance to hurry off, but the Hound picked him up by the scruff with ease. Surprising, and he finds that he doesn’t totally mind. 

‘It’s been a while since someone could do this’, he thinks, even if his back legs practically drag on the ground. ‘I could be into this’

But then, the traitorous Hound marches up to the door and throws him outside of the walls, slamming the entrance shut behind him. 

From inside he can hear Bran complain, “I was going to close the door.”

He shook himself of the shock, where was the respect for the sigil of this fine castle? 

‘I might as well take a shit, maybe find myself a fat rabbit if any are left.’

Somewhere up above Daenerys flys on Drogon. She was annoyed and attempting to cool down from her morning serving of Sansa Snark. She had told Jon twice now that she needed his sister to respect him and yet things remained the same. 

Dany had even tried to be kind. But today was her last day of attempts. 

She had offered to help Sansa brush out her dog this morning. It would have been of mutual benefit. The stupid thing shed like crazy, his white furs even managed to reach her rooms despite it never wandering into the guest wing of the castle. 

Sansa, of course, refused, “You should give your attention to your own pets, Your Grace.”

It was infuriating. Her children were not pets. She had given Sansa many chances, disrespect her so be it. Disrespect her children there would be consequences. 

So lost in her thoughts she was that the sudden speed of Drogon on the chase took her by surprise. She looked down. 

A wolf? Not just any wolf. Sansa’s. That’s what had gotten his attention. Could a pet plan revenge for his owner? No. But a child could. 

“Fuck those dragons!” could a direwolf not take a shit in peace anymore. He was already running back towards the castle at a speed he didn’t know he had 

Scarcely had he begun to dig up an area to relieve himself in when he caught the scent of the scaley beast. The service door was up ahead, surely the dragon would not attempt something inside the castle walls. 

Truth be told he couldn’t believe it was attempting something outside them. Has the stupid beast not seen the banners hung around the castle? I’m kind of a big deal here. 

He reached the door and pushed at it with his paws, letting his full weight fall on it. Any other day it would have given in, but not today. 

Bran, that little weirdo. He must have jammed it shut.

He turned to face the Dragon coming at him, mouth wide open, its teeth wet for his flesh. This was the end for him he knew. 

Nymeria was out there, she would come now that he’d be gone. He tried to feel for her, somewhere, to send a final message, “Stop being a forest thot and come home sister, they’ll need you now.” 

By the old gods, he would not give the beast the satisfaction of a delicious bite. 

He stood his ground and snarled, “Feast upon me monster! Savor my taste!”

And just as the dragon swallowed him into his mouth, he finally took his shit.
trail.content_abstract:
Ghost headcanon. 

Ghost is scared as hell of the dragons. He literally saw them coming down the Dany parade and hightailed it inside the castle cuss fuck that. He spends most of his time now hiding under the Stark kid beds. Which is why we never see him in 8X01. Bran’s bedroom is his favorite because he’s never in there and he can sleep on top of his bed. 

Arya and Bran don’t mind but Sansa does because he gets fur all over her clothes, so she drags him to a balcony near the lord’s chambers every morning so she can brush his fur out. Maybe she gathers up all the loose fur and places it downwind from Dany’s open window, maybe she doesn’t. 

One day, Ghost takes a giant shit inside the great hall and because he’s a good pupper and feels bad he stands next to it so people know it was him.  Not like there’s anyone else to blame. Maybe the Hound? Seems like something he’d do for the lolz. 

Or a really dramatic, ‘what if Dany kills Ghost thinking he belongs to Sansa as retribution to being disrespected and it parallels Cersei killing Lady back in S1.’

summary: Things that relieved me during episode 1: Sansa’s apology to Tyrion being borderline sarcastic and not about her self...
question: Things that relieved me during episode 1: Sansa’s apology to Tyrion being borderline sarcastic and not about her self deprecating Bran emoting when he reunited with Jon Theon being badass and then going north, meaning he’s reuniting with Sansa  Sansa Snark first of her name  Jon at least visibly not being comfortable on the dragon  Tyrion getting called out on all his shit, from the eunuch jokes to trusting Cersei  The fact that Jon not only said but emphasized to Dany how pretty his sister is
answer: I don’t think her apology was sarcastic, I think she was sincere, but at the same time, I don’t think that’s a bad thing. Look, if Sansa had apologized to Tyrion for being a ‘’bad child bride’’, I would’ve have thrown hands, however, she apologized for making an extremely reasonable decision that just happened to endanger him, and she, being the good and empathetic person that she is, felt bad about it. I did like her criticizing Tyrion for his blind faith in Cersei as well. That was really sastifying to watch.  Bran definitely developed a wider array of emotions. It’s not radically different, but it’s a positive change. Theon absolutely killed it this episode, and seeing him wanting to help fight for the Starks, who are his family, after all that happened, makes me so proud and emotional. It’s no surprise that Jon isn’t quite comfortable on the decision, it’s his first time. That being said, unlike Theon, Jon only grew and lived with the Starks. His identity revolves around the North and the Starks, and so when faced with a choice, he’s going to choose the only side that ever really mattered to him. There’s also Arya, who really surprised me this episode. Not in terms of siding with Sansa, but in terms of feeling so human this episode. She wasn’t just the emotionless killing machine the show pushed her to be last season. Seeing her smile, laugh, make jokes and flirt in this episode really great to see. Made me remember why I liked her so much in the first six seasons when I first watched the show. So yeah, the Starks are doing all right. Love that for them.

summary: I'm really nervous Dany's going to kill one of the Starks, specifically Sansa.  At the same time though, I know Sansa's too...
question: I'm really nervous Dany's going to kill one of the Starks, specifically Sansa.  At the same time though, I know Sansa's too smart to put herself or her family in danger.  I don't know.  I'm just stressed as shiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit.
answer: The Starks aren’t dying. When the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies and the pack survive. Remember? The Starks are now reunited, looking after one another, and working together. There’s multiple things that threaten them, but they are going to survive all of these situations by working together, and using each other’s capabilities to survive. It’s a time for wolves, so you’re not about to see them die off, you’re going to see them thrive.

summary: Esther Dot's answer to Does Sansa have a legit reason not to like Daenerys even though she just met her? - Quora
title: Esther Dot's answer to Does Sansa have a legit reason not to like Daenerys even though she just met her? - Quora
description:
Does Sansa have a legit reason not to like Daenerys even though she just met her?

There are a bunch of great responses here, so I will just add my thoughts in regarding the “just met” part of the question.

People in the fandom have spent a lot of time debating Jon bending the knee, the odd timing etc. We all know he doesn’t care about power, he just wants to protect his people. But we shouldn’t forget that the only reason he was ever in that position of power is because of Sansa. At Castle Black Jon was ready to run away, abandon everyone he knew and all of Westeros to the army of the dead. But then Sansa arrived and before dinner was over, she told Jon she was taking back Winterfell, with or without him. Sansa convinced Jon to go to war, and when he didn’t take her advice about needing more men, she used what little means she could to save him and win the Battle of the Bastards. Defeating Ramsay is how they took back Winterfell and the North; therefore, she is the reason Jon was proclaimed King in the North. I’m not saying she could have done it without him, but Jon never would have done it without her.

 Sansa knew what she was doing when she had Jon cosplay as Ned. That was about making the Northern Lords see Jon as his second coming. She put a direwolf on her own chest, telling everyone the Starks were back. Throughout s6 in various ways Sansa affirmed and reaffirmed who Jon was, a Stark, even without him having the name. Jon said “I’m not a Stark” and Sansa says, “You are to me,” but we already knew that because of how she treated him. She even offered him the Lords chambers, essentially telling him he was the head of the family. These are huge things she’s doing for him, but she isn’t just doing them for him. How she presented him to the North as a Stark, and her respect for him as a Stark, is an important part of what allows the North to see him as a true Stark and therefore proclaim him king. Jon would have never done that for himself, but Sansa did it for him.

Why am I saying all this? Because Jon becoming king wasn’t just an honor the Northerners bestowed on Jon, it was Sansa’s achievement. She has this satisfied smile when the Lords proclaim Jon king, and Jon looks at her immediately because this wasn’t just about him, it’s about them. They are in this together, and Jon knows that. In season 7 when he sends the raven about bending the knee, he writes that he has pledged “our” forces to Daenerys’ cause. As in, in his head as well as Sansa’s, they’re doing this together out of a mutual necessity, but also with an emotional interdependency because at the time, they’re the only family they have, they’re also kinda the only person the other trusts, although how much is sometimes a struggle. In s7 before Jon leaves they’re squabbling because in a strange way, they’re ruling as king and unofficial queen. It’s a complex situation, but basically, they are totally entangled with each other in the business of running the North.

I forgot to mention earlier that Sansa has suffered more and longer for Northern Independence than her remaining siblings and Jon. We need to remember that when Robb won victories in battle Sansa was beaten. Sansa has shed her own blood for Northern Independence since she was 13yo. The reason she married Ramsay was to get Winterfell and the North back. She was raped and tortured on top of her previous brutalization for her family and for the North. She and Jon have finally gotten it though, everything she has endured has been worth it because they have freedom and Sansa is finally safe.

I’m getting to my point, I promise, just a little more! SO, Sansa has witnessed Jon fall prey to mind games with Ramsay in spite of her warning. Against her advice Jon decides to go South. While he is away, without communicating with her, he decides to bend the knee to a queen that Littlefinger makes sure she knows is beautiful. Why is that an issue? Well, before Jon left Sansa had given Jon another piece of advice, be smarter than Robb. Jon has disregarded her advice several times now, so she assumes he disregarded it again. She assumes that Jon was dumb, that Daenerys seduced the Kingdom out of his hand. Sansa thought it was their kingdom, and Jon made this decision, seemingly once again ignoring her advice, making a mistake that in Sansa’s eyes may get him killed because that’s what happened to Robb.

So, Sansa had to watch Jon leave, worrying he wouldn’t come back. While he was away, she defended him, appeased the Lords, held their army together, and fended off a sexual harasser, all because she trusted Jon to do what he needed to do for the North. And he writes her a little note to say “I gave it all away.” I think Sansa trusts Jon, but she thinks he was manipulated in spite of her best efforts to prepare him. She concludes from this information that while she’s upset with Jon, it is Daenerys who has taken everything. Sansa sent Jon off to get dragonglass, and he returns, stripped of everything Sansa had worked so hard to get. Daenerys took Jon’s crown, and she took Sansa’s kingdom.

Of course Sansa doesn’t like Daenerys! I think it’s entirely justified. If anyone has gone through what Sansa has in trying to be free, they are not going to be thankful that the price tag for everyone on the continent not dying was their freedom. Sansa has accepted that it is, but that’s an awful indictment of Dany’s priorities, her concern for the Westerosi, her entitlement, and her regard for the will of the people. Daenerys could have settled for an alliance, she didn’t have to insist on the crown and kingdom. Dany shouldn’t have insisted on that. She could have found a reasonable compromise, but she had to have the North. Sansa knows this. She’s savvy. Sansa used Littlefinger’s interest in her to get an army, of course she thinks Daenarys used her beauty to get a kingdom. Sansa made up her mind about Daenerys before the Dragon Queen ever set foot in the North. This is no savior or liberator, this is a woman who takes, and takes, and takes. Sansa has had enough of people who take from her. She’s had enough of people who take her family from her. I think Sansa doesn’t realize exactly how dangerous Daenerys is, if she did she would assuredly suck up more, but she knows that Dany is a conqueror who uses many methods to get her way. Sansa hugs Jon, but her eyes are on Dany, her cool assessment of the would-be queen complete without ever exchanging a word.

summary: THERE'S PEOPLE SAYING THAT SANSA DISTRUSTS DANIELLE BECAUSE SHE IS PRETTIER THAN HER AND SHE IS JEAOLUS, I CAN'T WITH THIS...
question: THERE'S PEOPLE SAYING THAT SANSA DISTRUSTS DANIELLE BECAUSE SHE IS PRETTIER THAN HER AND SHE IS JEAOLUS, I CAN'T WITH THIS FANDOM ANYMORE
answer: People want to twist Sansa and her intentions in order to make it seem like she is the one being unreasonable, or that she’s just being petty. No, Sansa has legitimate concerns about Daenerys. All she knows about Daenerys thus far is that this new queen of hers is partially responsible for the wall falling, that Jon bending the knee to her is dividing the Northeners and that she doesn’t have rations for winter. Not only that, but Sansa is responsible to pay the consequences of these actions. It doesn’t help that Daenerys has shown no sign of even trying to win the respect of the Northeners nor has there been any substantial proof that she is remotely a good leader. However, according to them, all of these things are completely unimportant to Sansa, and Sansa is just concerned about the fact that Daenery is pretty.

blog.description:
I am a Stark of Winterfell

I am a writer of Jonsa

summary: Don’t
body:
Don’t

“Don’t talk,” she says as she comes to him before the battle.

His eyebrows shoot up and he jerks his head to the side excusing Davos for a moment.

He follows his former hand and shuts the door shoulders hunched in, giving Sansa a weary look.

Her breath rattles out, shaky and choppy as she whispers in a husky tone, “I brought the red woman back.”

His eyes go wild and his mouth opens instantly but she holds up her hand, “I told you not to speak.”

Taking a step forward, the space of his solar closing them in tight. “Your life means more to me than anything. If you fall she will bring you back.”

“Sansa..”

A pink blush travels over her features sparking a familiar warmth in her belly. Blue eyes snap back to his wanting to slap the gentleness from his lips, “Don’t.” She shakes her head, “No more speeches about dragons and fire Jon. I won’t hear it.”

Coming forward she stands in front of him the ice she uses to protect herself momentarily melting, giving herself a chance to be softer if only this once.

“You will hear this.” The pause is torturous and long, longer than she has. He sees her struggle and steps into her, the small space so warm she feels herself give in to something she’s tried to deny until this moment.

“If you die, so will I.”

He visibly swallows, but doesn’t otherwise respond. No chuckle or sardonic smile and somehow it makes it worse, his acknowledgment of her secrets makes it so much more painful.

“You must know that,” she somehow finds a way to say it without bitterness. Her shoulders straighten, “So allow me this trespass, allow me this chance. I could not live without knowledge of you alive somewhere warm, tucked away by a hearth with a broody brow…” Just the thought of his expression makes the tears form achingly in her throat, “Let me keep you alive.”

If it’s possible for them to get closer he somehow finds a way, his leather protesting with each hesitant step.

Close to her he sees her own armor and Sam’s voice trickles through the battle plans and doom that surrounds them, reminding him of the truth.

Aching fingers, wild and void of any thought reach forward and trace the lines of her leather tight at her ribs. Gods, if she is not as majestic as she is beautiful.

Her eyes flit from his stormy ones to his fingers that still trace her bodice, the air of the room tepid with melting facade. She blinks trying to pull back up her mask, but when her mouth opens and she says his name it’s so tortured and sad she knows he will hear every undertone of longing she’s fought to submerge.

“Jon…”

He grips her then, a gentle but steady hand on her waist. A gasp and moan released between them and then their bodies are pushed against the other, the beginning of hers molding into the ending of him; one flesh and neither of them react in surprise. The rightness is a relief, a weight lifted before he goes out into the night.

“Can I speak?” He whispers at her chin, her perfect mouth open and hot breath in his face.

She nods her head, and swallows unable now to remember that anything else but this matters.

“The next time we see each other I’ll tell you about my mother and what it means.”

Then his hands move grazing her leather, arms and face. He pushes them back into her hair leaving no room for her to doubt, “I promise.”

She wets her lips and her brow furrows in confusion. Her eyes narrow and just as she’s ready to question him, he shakes his head to stop her.

“No,” he says fingers light against her mouth. “Don’t talk now.”

Do I think this will actually happen? No but it was fun! 🐺❤️

“You must know that,” she somehow finds a way to say it without bitterness. Her shoulders straighten, “So allow me this trespass, allow me this chance. I could not live without knowledge of you alive somewhere warm, tucked away by a hearth with a broody brow…” Just the thought of his expression makes the tears form achingly in her throat, “Let me keep you alive.”

If it’s possible for them to get closer he somehow finds a way, his leather protesting with each hesitant step.

Close to her he sees her own armor and Sam’s voice trickles through the battle plans and doom that surrounds them, reminding him of the truth.

Aching fingers, wild and void of any thought reach forward and trace the lines of her leather tight at her ribs. Gods, if she is not as majestic as she is beautiful.

Her eyes flit from his stormy ones to his fingers that still trace her bodice, the air of the room tepid with melting facade. She blinks trying to pull back up her mask, but when her mouth opens and she says his name it’s so tortured and sad she knows he will hear every undertone of longing she’s fought to submerge.

“Jon…”

He grips her then, a gentle but steady hand on her waist. A gasp and moan released between them and then their bodies are pushed against the other, the beginning of hers molding into the ending of him; one flesh and neither of them react in surprise. The rightness is a relief, a weight lifted before he goes out into the night.

“Can I speak?” He whispers at her chin, her perfect mouth open and hot breath in his face.

She nods her head, and swallows unable now to remember that anything else but this matters.

“The next time we see each other I’ll tell you about my mother and what it means.”

Then his hands move grazing her leather, arms and face. He pushes them back into her hair leaving no room for her to doubt, “I promise.”

She wets her lips and her brow furrows in confusion. Her eyes narrow and just as she’s ready to question him, he shakes his head to stop her.

“No,” he says fingers light against her mouth. “Don’t talk now.”

Do I think this will actually happen? No but it was fun! 🐺❤️
trail.content:
Don’t

“Don’t talk,” she says as she comes to him before the battle.

His eyebrows shoot up and he jerks his head to the side excusing Davos for a moment.

He follows his former hand and shuts the door shoulders hunched in, giving Sansa a weary look.

Her breath rattles out, shaky and choppy as she whispers in a husky tone, “I brought the red woman back.”

His eyes go wild and his mouth opens instantly but she holds up her hand, “I told you not to speak.”

Taking a step forward, the space of his solar closing them in tight. “Your life means more to me than anything. If you fall she will bring you back.”

“Sansa..”

A pink blush travels over her features sparking a familiar warmth in her belly. Blue eyes snap back to his wanting to slap the gentleness from his lips, “Don’t.” She shakes her head, “No more speeches about dragons and fire Jon. I won’t hear it.”

Coming forward she stands in front of him the ice she uses to protect herself momentarily melting, giving herself a chance to be softer if only this once.

“You will hear this.” The pause is torturous and long, longer than she has. He sees her struggle and steps into her, the small space so warm she feels herself give in to something she’s tried to deny until this moment.

“If you die, so will I.”
